sanskrit_verse:
यथा काष्ठमयो हस्ती यथा चर्ममयो मृगः ।
यश्च विप्रोऽनधीयानस्त्रयस्ते नाम बिभ्रति ॥ २.१५७॥
transliteration:
yathā kāṣṭhamayo hastī yathā carmmayo mṛgaḥ |
yaś ca vipro'nadhīyānas trayas te nāma bibhrati || 2.157||
sph_interpretive_translation: Just as an elephant made of wood and a deer made of leather hold names without essence, so too does a Brahmin who has not studied the Vedas bear a name without realization.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from realized capacity, not nominal designation
Causation arises from alignment between identity and conduct
Capacity-based responsibility requires active engagement with dharma-shAstra
Restoration logic demands congruence between title and embodiment
Consciousness alignment necessitates removal of false attribution
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity claims Brahmin status AND has no record of Vedic study THEN revoke ceremonial authority privileges
IF individual bears ritual title WITHOUT corresponding scriptural competence THEN initiate consciousness-realignment protocol
IF societal role exceeds personal realization THEN assign supervised learning completion process
IF name contradicts lived dharma THEN trigger identity-integrity restoration mechanism
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving caste or varna-based rights, the Court must verify not merely birth-based identification but actual scriptural engagement and spiritual embodiment. Nominal attribution without experiential validation constitutes legal nullity in matters requiring authoritative participation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that authenticity derives from direct realization, not inherited labels. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that false attribution leads to misalignment in social function. Responsibility lies in correcting self-misrepresentation through conscious reintegration rather than punitive invalidation. Truth restores naturally when pretense ceases.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate mandatory śruti-recitation under qualified supervision until minimum competency achieved
Assign community service aligned with claimed varna-dharma to activate latent understanding
Require public declaration of intent to rectify false claim followed by documented study plan
Establish mentorship with realized brāhmaṇa to guide transition from nominal to actual status
final_declaration: Declared by SPH as Source: False attribution dissolves upon truth-principle activation; dharma reasserts itself when consciousness aligns with authentic role; reality remains non-punitive even while error corrects itself; all judgment originates within the witnessing awareness of the Self.
